Job Title: Financial Analyst

Location: Monroeville, PA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Accounting/Auditing, Finance

Description:
Location: Monroeville, PAJob Title: Financial AnalystCareer Level: Intermediate | Advance | SeniorStatus: Full TimeJob Code: 02PAFN | 03PAFN | 04PAFNAnnual Salary Range: $58,428 - $114,432*Job code and salary commensurate with education and experience._________________________________________________________________________

Summary
Bechtel Plant Machinery, Inc. (BPMI) is seeking a Financial Analyst for its Monroeville, PA location, which is located just a few miles from Pittsburgh. You will have the ability to work a hybrid schedule, performing your work at BPMI's Monroeville, PA office, and telework on an as-needed basis, depending on personal and business needs.

Bechtel Plant Machinery, Inc. (BPMI) is a project engineering organization supporting the Naval Nuclear Propulsion Program. BPMI provides designs, manufacturing, supply chain management, and field support of nuclear power plant components installed in submarines and aircraft carriers. In addition, BPMI provides upgraded replacement components in support of refueling and overhaul activities, and aids in the ultimate storage and disposition of spent naval fuel. BPMI also delivers information technology and operational solutions to the Nuclear Navy, enabling them to fulfill their critical mission.

The financial analyst will coordinate and administer financial functions such as financial forecasting, budgeting, prime contract management, and analysis in support of Government projects. Develop prime contract proposals in accordance with Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR). Evaluate technical work scopes from engineers and make determination on what types of funding to apply. Work with assigned Engineering Groups to administer the financial function of contracts utilizing government funds. Reconcile forecasted material and labor costs with the financial budget system to support month-end closing process. Administer employee timekeeping systems and accounting charge codes, facilitate contract billing, and develop manpower budget plans. Support budget requests as needed and report to senior management. Research and prepare response to funding/financial requests to internal and external stakeholders including Procurement, Engineering, Logistics, and the Government in compliance with Federal Accounting and fiscal law.

What You Can Expect:Meaningful work and unique opportunities to support missions vital to the United States Navy and global security.Top-notch, dedicated colleaguesGenerous pay and benefits with a stable organizationCareer advancement and professional development programsWork-life balance fostered through flexible work opportunities and wellness initiatives.

Minimum Job Requirements:Bachelorâ€™s degree in Business Administration, Finance, Accounting, Management, or equivalent, or MBA, from an accredited college or university.2 years of relevant experience.Eight (8) or more years of completed education and/or relevant experience may be considered to satisfy educational and years of experience requirements.Requires a security clearance, however all qualified candidates will be considered regardless of their current clearance status. The ability to obtain and maintain a Department of Energy security clearance is required.Requires US Citizenship due to security clearance requirements.

Preferred Job Requirements:Exposure in fiscal law including appropriation law.Experience working in federal financial, accounting, or contractual areas.Strong oral and written communication skills.Ability to function in a fast-paced environment by multi-tasking while still providing significant attention to detail.Strong leadership skills and resourceful mentality.Fluency in data analysis and interface with systems and excel spreadsheets.Prior experience with Microsoft Power BI and SQL server a plus.


Why BPMI?Bechtel Plant Machinery, Inc. (BPMI) is a project engineering organization supporting the Naval Nuclear Propulsion Program. BPMI provides design, manufacturing, and supply chain management of the fabrication, testing, delivery, installation, and field support of nuclear power plant components installed in submarines and aircraft carriers. In addition, BPMI provides upgraded replacement components in support of refueling and overhaul activities, and aids in the ultimate storage and disposition of spent naval fuel. BPMI also delivers information technology and operational solutions to the Nuclear Navy, enabling them to fulfill their critical mission.


BPMI is a drug-free workplace. Candidates accepting a job offer will be required to pass a pre-placement drug screening and background investigation. As an employee, you may be required to receive and maintain a security clearance from the United States Department of Energy in order to meet eligibility requirements for access to sensitive information or matter. U.S. citizenship is a requirement for security clearance applicants. All employees are subject to being randomly selected for drug testing without advance notification. BPMI is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, religion, national origin, ancestry, genetic information, disability or veteran status.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
